claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Snippet of the title, authors, and beginning of the abstract of an original article comparing recombinant and standard-dose influenza vaccines. The visible text of the background states that trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines. Evidence: “trivalent recombinant influenza vaccines contain three times the amount of hemagglutinin protein as standard-dose egg-based vaccines” This statement confirms the 3× hemagglutinin content of the recombinant vaccine but does not mention or provide evidence about greater immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in full.
